left.name: program_id
left.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.

data.name: program_id
data.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.

left.name: pathological_tumour_staging_system
left.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected. Pathological classification is based on the clinical stage information (acquired before treatment) and supplemented/modified by operative findings and pathological evaluation of the resected specimen.

data.name: pathological_tumour_staging_system
data.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected. Pathological classification is based on the clinical stage information (acquired before treatment) and supplemented/modified by operative findings and pathological evaluation of the resected specimen.

left.name: pathological_t_category
left.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the size or contiguous extension of the primary tumour (T), according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

right.name: pathological_t_category
right.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the size or contiguous extension of the primary tumour (T), according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

left.name: pathological_n_category
left.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by whether or not the cancer has reached nearby lymph nodes (N), according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

right.name: pathological_n_category
right.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by whether or not the cancer has reached nearby lymph nodes (N), according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

left.name: pathological_m_category
left.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by whether there are distant metastases (M), meaning spread of cancer to other parts of the body, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

right.name: pathological_m_category
right.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by whether there are distant metastases (M), meaning spread of cancer to other parts of the body, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

left.name: pathological_stage_group
left.description: Specify the tumour stage, based on tumor_staging_system, used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected.

right.name: pathological_stage_group
right.description: Specify the tumour stage, based on tumor_staging_system, used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected.

left.name: specimen_acquisition_interval
left.description: Interval between primary diagnosis and specimen acquisition, in days.

data.name: specimen_acquisition_interval
data.description: Interval between primary diagnosis and specimen acquisition, in days.

left.name: tumour_histological_type
left.description: The code to represent the histology (morphology) of neoplasms that is usually obtained from a pathology report, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3).

right.name: tumour_histological_type
right.description: The code to represent the histology (morphology) of neoplasms that is usually obtained from a pathology report, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3).

left.name: specimen_anatomic_location
left.description: Anatomic location of a specimen when it was collected.

data.name: specimen_anatomic_location
data.description: Anatomic location of a specimen when it was collected.

left.name: specimen_processing
left.description: Description of technique used to process specimen.

codeList: Cryopreservation of live cells in liquid nitrogen

data.name: specimen_processing
data.description: Description of technique used to process specimen.

codeList: Cryopreservation of live cells in liquid nitrogen

left.name: specimen_storage
left.description: Description of how specimen was stored for specimens that were not extracted freshly or immediately cultured.

data.name: specimen_storage
data.description: Description of how specimen was stored for specimens that were not extracted freshly or immediately cultured.

left.name: central_pathology_confirmed
left.description: Indicate whether the histologic description of tissue or cells was confirmed by a pathology review of frozen or formalin fixed slide(s) completed after the diagnostic pathology review of the tumour sample used to extract analyte(s).

right.name: central_pathology_confirmed
right.description: Indicate whether the histologic description of tissue or cells was confirmed by a pathology review of frozen or formalin fixed slide(s) completed after the diagnostic pathology review of the tumour sample used to extract analyte(s).

left.name: tumour_grading_system
left.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to assess the description of a tumour based on how abnormal the tumour cells and the tumour tissue look under a microscope. Tumour grade is an indicator of how quickly a tumour is likely to  grow.

right.name: tumour_grading_system
right.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to assess the description of a tumour based on how abnormal the tumour cells and the tumour tissue look under a microscope. Tumour grade is an indicator of how quickly a tumour is likely to  grow.

left.name: tumour_grade
left.description: Grade of the tumour as assigned by the reporting tumour_grading_system.

right.name: tumour_grade
right.description: Grade of the tumour as assigned by the reporting tumour_grading_system.

left.name: percent_tumour_cells
left.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percentage of infiltration by tumour cells in a specimen.

right.name: percent_tumour_cells
right.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percentage of infiltration by tumour cells in a specimen.

left.name: percent_proliferating_cells
left.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the count of proliferating cells determined during pathologic review of the specimen.

right.name: percent_proliferating_cells
right.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the count of proliferating cells determined during pathologic review of the specimen.

left.name: percent_inflammatory_tissue
left.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents local response to cellular injury, marked by capillary dilatation, edema and leukocyte infiltration; clinically, inflammation is manifest by redness, heat, pain, swelling and loss of function, with the need to heal damaged tissue.

right.name: percent_inflammatory_tissue
right.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents local response to cellular injury, marked by capillary dilatation, edema and leukocyte infiltration; clinically, inflammation is manifest by redness, heat, pain, swelling and loss of function, with the need to heal damaged tissue.

left.name: percent_stromal_cells
left.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percentage of reactive cells that are present in a malignant tumour specimen but are not malignant such as fibroblasts, vascular structures, etc.

right.name: percent_stromal_cells
right.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percentage of reactive cells that are present in a malignant tumour specimen but are not malignant such as fibroblasts, vascular structures, etc.

left.name: percent_necrosis
left.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percentage of cell death in a malignant tumour specimen.

right.name: percent_necrosis
right.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percentage of cell death in a malignant tumour specimen.

left.description: Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.
left.name: submitter_donor_id

right.description: Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.
right.name: submitter_donor_id

left.description: Cause of a donor's death.
left.name: cause_of_death

right.description: Cause of a donor's death.
right.name: cause_of_death

left.description: Interval of how long the donor has survived since primary diagnosis, in days.
left.name: survival_time

right.description: Interval of how long the donor has survived since primary diagnosis, in days.
right.name: survival_time

left.description: Indicate Body Mass Index (BMI) in kg/m².
left.name: bmi

right.description: Indicate BMI in kg/m².
right.name: bmi

left.name: submitter_donor_id
left.description: Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.

right.name: submitter_donor_id
right.description: Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.

left.name: clinical_stage_group
left.description: Stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.).

right.name: clinical_stage_group
right.description: Stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.).

left.name: stage_suffix
left.description: If necessary, use this field to add any applicable stage suffixes. Stage suffixes may apply to certain staging systems such as Ann Arbour staging system where the four stages are divided into 4 categories (A, B, X and E).

right.name: stage_suffix
right.description: If necessary, use this field to add any applicable stage suffixes. Stage suffixes may apply to certain staging systems such as Ann Arbour staging system where the four stages are divided into 4 categories (A, B, X and E).

left.name: clinical_t_category
left.description: The code to represent the extent of the primary tumour (T) based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

right.name: clinical_t_category
right.description: The code to represent the extent of the primary tumour (T) based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

left.name: clinical_n_category
left.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by which is the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

right.name: clinical_n_category
right.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by which is the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

left.name: clinical_m_category
left.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined bythe extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual. MX is NOT a valid category and cannot be assigned.

right.name: clinical_m_category
right.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined bythe extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual. MX is NOT a valid category and cannot be assigned.

right.name: acquisition_interval
right.description: Interval between primary diagnosis and specimen acquisition, in days.

data.name: acquisition_interval
data.description: Interval between primary diagnosis and specimen acquisition, in days.

right.name: anatomic_location_of_specimen_collection
right.description: Anatomic location of a specimen when it was collected.

data.name: anatomic_location_of_specimen_collection
data.description: Anatomic location of a specimen when it was collected.

right.name: tumour_staging_system
right.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected. Pathological classification is based on the clinical stage information (acquired before treatment) and supplemented/modified by operative findings and pathological evaluation of the resected specimen.

data.name: tumour_staging_system
data.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected. Pathological classification is based on the clinical stage information (acquired before treatment) and supplemented/modified by operative findings and pathological evaluation of the resected specimen.
